meanings.definition: The action of putting off or delaying something.
meanings.sent1: She requested deferments for her assignments to have more time to complete them.
meanings.sent2: The deferments of the project deadline allowed the team to gather more data.
meanings.sent3: His constant deferments of doing the dishes led to a mountain of dirty plates in the sink.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination can be seen as a series of deferments, each one pushing the task further away.
meanings.sent5: The student's deferments of studying eventually caught up with him during the final exam.

meanings.definition: The act of postponing military service.
meanings.sent1: Many young men applied for deferments to continue their education before serving in the military.
meanings.sent2: His deferments from military duty allowed him to work on his family's farm.
meanings.sent3: The soldier's deferments from deployment made him the unofficial expert on base trivia.
meanings.sent4: The deferments in enlistment dates created a sense of uncertainty among the recruits.
meanings.sent5: The deferments in the draft schedule gave the recruits a brief reprieve from training.
